intro: Erythrochilus, commonly known as the red-lipped orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their striking red lips on the petals, which often serve as a visual attractant for pollinators. They are native to various regions in Australia, particularly in the southern and eastern parts of the country. Erythrochilus species typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The genus includes several species, each with unique floral structures and growth habits that reflect their specific ecological niches.
